reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed for two nights at 38 St Giles and I WISH we could have stayed longer!! Everything about this wonderful B&B was just perfect. The building itself is gorgeous and in the ideal location within Norwich city center. The rooms are incredible - so tastefully decorated, immaculate, homey, perfectly maintained. And Jan is just wonderful - from the amazing selection of little treats she leaves for guests in their rooms (as opposed to the typical packets of biscuits), the little extra things she does to make her guests feel at home, to the incredible breakfasts she prepares, everything was just fanastic. We had the added pleasure of meeting Dobby the cat, as well, who sat with us as we read the morning paper.
reviews.title: Amazing in every way!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I travel frequently and are quite picky - and rarely have we stayed in a place that truly felt like home. Highly, highly recommend!!
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: This has to be the best B&B ever, feels more like a 5* hotel. Jan, the bubbly and enthusiastic owner is truly wonderful, nothing is too much trouble. Within 5 minutes of arriving she had delivered delicious home made muffins and a huge pot of tea to our room, yum! We only spent one night here but will definitely be booking a much longer stay next time. Our room was right at the top of this magnificent house and was simply beautiful. The room has recently undergone a very sympathetic refurb, uneven walls and floors, which thank the lord have not been rectified, add to the very charm of this property. Our bathroom was immaculate with one of the best showers we have ever used. The location could not be better, as we found it so easy to get everywhere within a few minutes of walking out of the front doors. Despite its central location it is incredibly quiet and we slept extremely well in our "ever so comfy bed". Breakfast was sublime, small touches like good yoghurt, honey and blueberries and freshly squeezed juice already at our table, added to the feel that Jan really cares about her guests. We both opted for the Full English, which was very well cooked , with bacon and sausage to die for. We could have also had organic cereals and muesli. Despite feeling completely replete we could not resist the tempation of the homemade jams and marmalade.....delicious! This is one place we will definitely be coming back to.
reviews.title: Totally amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 38 St Giles is the most amazing place. A beautiful historic property, sensitively refurbished and restored and very stylishly furnished. The standard is very high end and truly 5 star. The quality interior is paired with amazing and genuinely warm service. Jan, one of the owners recommended a great restaurant and as it was a bit difficult to find, walked me there despite the rain and the cold.
reviews.title: This should be the universal standard!

likes.liked: — Highest possible standard set by Jan Cheeseman and family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was probably the best hotel breakfast I have ever had. Everything is home made and expertly cooked. I particularly loved the porridge with caramelized apple and the home made marmelade and jams.
reviews.title: Hidden gem

reviews.text: Total perfection in every way. Fantastic breakfast, superb room, very friendly service, wonderful central location perfect for a couple of days in Norwich city centre.
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: "Absolutely faultless" is my entry in their guest book and that says it all.
reviews.title: Absolutely Faultless

reviews.text: A very central location, easy to walk a few hundred yards into Norwich centre. Elegant rooms with a very well thought-out layout.
reviews.title: A Hostess with Passion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Brown Room - bedroom with a large and comfortable double bed, wardrobe, B&O TV and Virgin cable, good lighting. Seperate small room with tea/coffee and home-made cakes and sofa. Seperate WC and finally a great and roomy shower and washbasin, with very nice L'Occitane shower gel, shampoo etc.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice additional touches such as being asked what newspaper we would like in the morning and a superb breakfast, with a clear focus on local and organic produce.
reviews.title: If you enjoy amazing service !!!

likes.liked: — Quality, service, proximatey to city and good restaurants.
likes.disliked: — That I had to go home eventually!
